content:
Hey folks, I'm new here! My name is Remy-with-the-long-Dutch-surname, and I'm currently a maths postdoc in Utrecht. I'm recovering from a MathOverflow addiction (and not sure I'm completely ready for a new one yet ;) )
I don't consider myself particularly good at coding stuff, so I am looking forward to being confused by all of it!
Hi Remy! Don't forget to check out our still somewhat empty #Leiden Lean group stream.
Hey Remy! Check out "Algebraic geometry development" in #maths for the current state of the debate about how best to define sheaves of modules in a theorem prover :-)

Johan Commelin said:

Welkom!

Goh, jij hier :open_mouth:
I just stumbled upon this very old Stackexchange question that features both Mario Carneiro and a certain Josse van Dobben de Bruyn. Quite a coincidence!
was that supposed to contain a link?

Yaël Dillies said:

I just stumbled upon this very old Stackexchange question that features both Mario Carneiro and a certain Josse van Dobben de Bruyn. Quite a coincidence!

That's my twin brother! (The consensus seems to be that I'm the evil one.) I've been trying to get him into Lean stuff as well, as he's much better at coding than myself, but everything at its time I suppose...
Oi Yael, don't point him back at the stackexchange sites, he's here now and a recovering addict! (I was one of those about 7 years ago)
